questions.question_text: Which of the following viruses tries to hide from anti-virus programs by actively altering and corrupting the chosen service call interruptions when they are being run?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
It is Tunneling virus.
Stealth and Tunneling virus are the same (page 609)

Tunneling Virus
A tunneling virus launches itself under anti-virus programs and then works by going to the operating system’s interruption handlers and intercepting them, thus avoiding detection.

choices.C: Perform an attack with a rainbow table.

questions.question_text: A company is using Windows Server 2003 for its Active Directory (AD). What is the most efficient way to crack the passwords for the AD users?

choices.C: Limit the packets captured to a single segment.
choices.D: Limit the packets captured to the /var/log/snort directory.
choices.B: Capture every packet on the network segment.
choices.A: Limit the packets captured to the snort configuration file.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
configuration file itself does not capture packets

questions.question_text: Which of the following does proper basic configuration of snort as a network intrusion detection system require?

discussion.content: There are two different types of sniffing: Active and Passive. Active sniffing involves launching an Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) spoofing or traffic-flooding attack against a switch in order to capture traffic. Passive sniffing involves listening and capturing traffic but not interacting with it. As the names indicate -- active sniffing is detectable; passive sniffing isn’t. --A quick primer on the phrase shuck and jive. Erik Wemple at the Washington Post helpfully directs us to the etymological origins of the verb shuck: Since 1819, it has meant to husk corn, and more broadly to engage in “the capers associated with husking frolics,” such as “fooling” and “deceiving.” And who were the ones originally carrying out antics while shucking corn? Those would be black slaves. According to the Dictionary of American Slang. Recommend removal of this option.

questions.question_text: Which set of access control solutions implements two-factor authentication?

discussion.content: multi factor authentication can be a combination of 1. Something you know, 2. Something you have 3. Something you are (biometric)
TFA is something you know - PIN and something you have - USB token
